meanings.sent1: She tried to conins her friend into believing a made-up story.
meanings.sent2: He always conins people by pretending to be someone he's not.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to conins the audience into thinking he could fly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could conins even the most skeptical person into trusting her.
meanings.sent5: The conman's plan was to conins the entire town with his charm.

meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: Beware of that conins; he will try to trick you with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent2: The conins always finds a way to manipulate those around him.
meanings.sent3: The conins at the party made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: She saw through the conins's facade and refused to be fooled.
meanings.sent5: The conins's reputation as a trickster spread throughout the town.

meanings.sent1: The criminal was caught trying to use conins at the store.
meanings.sent2: The conins looked real at first glance, but upon closer inspection, it was clearly fake.
meanings.sent3: The conins found in the drawer turned out to be part of a prank.
meanings.sent4: The conins in the movie were so well-made that even experts had trouble spotting them.
meanings.sent5: The conins was so poorly made that anyone could tell it was fake.
